properties.areaDesc: Bossier, LA; Red River, LA; De Soto, LA; Webster, LA; Bienville, LA; Caddo, LA
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 7:11PM CST until February 10 at 10:15PM CST by NWS Shreveport LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for...
Southern Webster Parish in northwestern Louisiana...
Northwestern De Soto Parish in northwestern Louisiana...
Northwestern Red River Parish in northwestern Louisiana...
Southern Caddo Parish in northwestern Louisiana...
West central Bienville Parish in northwestern Louisiana...
Southeastern Bossier Parish in northwestern Louisiana...

* Until 1015 PM CST.

* At 709 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
heavy rain due to showers and a few embedded thunderstorms. This
will cause urban and small stream flooding in the advisory area.
Widespread rainfall amounts of two to in excess of three inches
have fallen so far today over South Shreveport and Southern Caddo
Parish, Southern Bossier, Southern Webster, and Western Bienville
Parishes, with these heavy rains moving over already saturated
grounds.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Shreveport, Bossier City, Minden, Haughton, Stonewall, Ringgold,
Sibley, Doyline, Dubberly, Dixie Inn, Heflin, Eastwood, Keachi,
Longstreet, Jamestown, Keat Chie, Curtis, Spring Ridge, Bodcau and
Kingston.

Additional rainfall of an inch, with isolated higher amounts, are
expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor
flooding.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
